headline.main: The Candidates Go Wheel to Wheel

docs.abstract: Debbie Dust letter holds that Aug 1 article pays more attention to mountain biking, Pres Bush's sport of choice, than to road cycling, John Kerry's sport of choice; drawing
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Culture Wars, on Two Wheels'' (Week in Review, Aug. 1) pays more attention to mountain biking, President Bush's sport of choice, than to road cycling, John Kerry's sport of choice. You seem to glorify the carnage of mountain biking and even imply that road cyclists are ''wussies.'' As a professional road racer and licensed cycling coach, I wonder if you have ever felt the rush of descending the side of a mountain at 60 miles an hour on a road bike, knowing you are centimeters from peril, or the excitement and sheer terror of navigating a corner at 35 miles an hour, wondering if the wheels will fall out from under you.
